content: “If powerful men have no female friends (and someone you cannot have a private conversation with isn’t a true friend), then they are running the world in a state of profound, mostly unacknowledged, ignorance about women’s experiences, needs and lives.” I believe this is the desired outcome. It is a feature of the rule, not a bug. To be ignorant of women’s experiences, needs and lives is to be freed from considering them in policy or practice. Pence, and perhaps others, might reply “You say that like its a bad thing!”
